src.rag.crosslingual_search module

class src.rag.crosslingual_search.CrosslingualSearch(multilingual_search: MultilingualSearch)[source]

Bases: object

Search across languages e.g., query in Hindi, get results in English (or other languages)

search_across_languages(query: str, target_languages: List[str], corpus_embeddings: Any, top_k: int = 10) → Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]][source]

Search for same concept across multiple languages.

Parameters:

  • query – The search query (in any language)

  • target_languages – List of language codes to filter results by (if corpus supports it)

  • corpus_embeddings – The embeddings to search against

  • top_k – Number of results per language

Returns:

Dictionary mapping language code to list of results

src.rag.multilingual_search module

class src.rag.multilingual_search.MultilingualSearch[source]

Bases: object

process_query(query: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Process query for any language

search(query: str, corpus_embeddings: ndarray, top_k: int = 10) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Search across multilingual corpus. Note: This assumes corpus_embeddings is a numpy array of all document embeddings. In a real DB scenario, we would pass the query embedding to the DB. This method is useful for in-memory search or re-ranking.
